inclusion.criterion: Clinical Suspicion of Acute Appendicitis: Alvarado Score 7-8 (probably appendicitis)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Means of follow-up assessment: telephone interview (or e-mail)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The investigators estimate a sample size of 160, the number of patients with suspected acute appendicitis we typically receive yearly in the ED.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Who returns for the follow-up visit 5 days after the ED visit and consents participation
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: IBD history or suspicion of IBD recrudescence
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has severe migratory pain in the right lower quadrant of his abdomen, accompanied by nausea and vomiting. He was febrile with tenderness, rebound tenderness and guarding on palpation.
